name: Information-Energy Equivalence
description: The ability of a swarm to convert information (measurement and sorting) into thermodynamic work (Temperature Gradient), effectively acting as a Maxwell's Demon.
findings: Implemented a Maxwell's Demon mechanism in the swarm.
The Demon selectively gated agents based on velocity (Hot to Right, Cold to Left).
A significant temperature gradient (Delta T = 1.00) emerged spontaneously from an initially equilibrium state.
This confirms that the swarm can pay for local order creation with information processing.
implications: Swarms can harvest energy from thermal noise if they have information.
Computation is thermodynamically coupled to the environment.
Self-organization is a process of information-driven entropy reduction.
